intro: Alyssum vindobonense, commonly known as the Austrian alyssum, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, feathery appearance. Alyssum vindobonense is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
